text:
Food & Drinks By Dessidre Fleming , Friday, 10 Feb 2017 
Some of Humphrey Bogart’s last words were as such: “I should never have shifted from Scotch to Martinis.” 
We’re talking about one of the most iconic Hollywood actors, ever. And unless you plan to die with the very same regret, why don’t you take a pledge this International Scotch Day, that thou shall never drink anything but Scotch. 
And just to make things a bit more interesting, we got Afzal Kaba and Nick Ord, United Spirits Brand Ambassador, to stir up 4 exclusive Scotch-based cocktails, prepared using Black and White, Black Dog Triple Gold Reserve, VAT 69 and Johnnie Walker Red Label, for you to try out next time you want to mix things up with your Scotch! 1. James Julep 
What: A smooth blend of honey and mint with Black and White Whiskey. 
Glass Type: High Ball 
Black and White Whisky 45 ml 
Honey Water 45 ml 
Mint leaves 20 Nos 
Soda Top Up 
How: Take a high-ball glass and pour the whiskey and honey water one after the other. Top it up with soda and a mint sprig on the edge. Garnish with mint sprigs. 2. The 69th Barrel 
What: Old-fashioned with a twist! Vat 69 Whisky served with star anise and apple. 
Glass Type: Rocks 
Vat 69 Whisky 60 ml 
Star Anise 2 Nos 
Apple Juice 45 ml 
Angostura Bitters 2 Drops 
How: Pour your ingredients one after the other in glass and build it up, gently stir it and your drink is ready! Garnish with cherries. 3. Black Dog Gold Coin © Diageo 
What: Black Dog Triple Gold Reserve served with cinnamon and a touch of Sauvignon Blanc. 
Glass Type: Rocks 
Black Dog Triple Gold Reserve 60 ml 
Cinnamon Syrup 15 ml 
Sauvignon Blanc 30 ml 
How: Take all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and gently shake it. Serve it in a rock glass with a slice of apple and cinnamon sticks on the edge. Garnish with apple and cinnamon. 4. Red Label Mule © Diageo 
What: Johnnie Walker Red Label married with sweetness and spice to create this signature serve of ginger ale and fresh citrus. 
Glass Type: High Ball 
Johnnie Walker Red Label 45 ml 
Angostura bitters 2 Drops 
Lime Slice 2 Nos 
Ginger Ale Top Up 
How: Take a high ball glass and gently pour the ingredients one after the other. Top it up with Ginger Ale and some lemon slices. Garnish with lemon slice.
